newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Avesta says to expand Taiwan cooperation.
newsitem.headline: Avesta says to expand Taiwan cooperation.

text.p: Swedish-British steel company Avesta Sheffield AB has signed a letter of intent with Taiwan's economic ministry about cooperation, according to an article in its internal company newspaper.
The cooperation covers development of technique, production and deals within stainless steel, the company said.
Avesta also intends to expand its cooperation with Gloria Heavy Industrial Corp in Taiwan.
"The companies will continue to develop their relations to mutual advantage," the statement signed by the companies said.
"Thereby they will ensure shares in the growing steel market in the Asian South Pacific region and they will set up efficient distribution channels to the region."
The companies intend to start a strategic alliance to make use of business opportunities, Avesta Sheffield said.
They will exchange technical information and Avesta Sheffield will guarantee Gloria certain volumes.
The companies will also look into new ways of cooperation, for example within sales and production.
